intro: Malcolmia lacera var. broussonetii, commonly known as the slender malcolmia, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features slender, branched stems and produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, giving them a slightly fuzzy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments.
